i figured out my problem with nvidia drivers.. each time i reboot, the nvidia kernel is disposed of and the ubuntu nvidia kernel is used instead, which isn't compatible with my drivers... so i need to run the nvidia installer at boot time to place the kernel module where it should be
you can remove the module instead
how would i do that?
with rmmod
rmmod removes modules (if the kernel supports removal of modules)
with modprobe you can then load the module you want
as far as i know, both modules are called nvidia
there must be a different files in the filesystem if they are different modules
you can search in the /lib/modules directory for all nvidia modules
if there is a name conflict probably you need to remove the "wrong" module
would it be possible to remove the nvidia kernel module package ? (there must be one, right?)
sure, if you are using a stock kernel it should be safe to remove that package... I haven't done it (I use kernel.org kernels) so be careful when removing it
